column5: I am going on a fly in fishing trip in July-- I needed a portable fish finder- mainly for depth. So, I bought the fishin buddy 110. After putting it together, I realize the shaft that connects the unit to the transducer is only 24 inches. The fly in we are using has standard camp style lund boats with a 9.9 or 15hp motor, like you see everywhere.My question is- will this unit work, or is the shaft too short to reach the water?
Those boats usually have a 20" or shorter transom, so you should be fine.
I have used one for many years on several fly ins and it always has worked.B-

I have a 140, like the extendable transducer and also the down and side transducer. Ive actually seen fish out to the side casted and watched them follow my hook in and took it. I keep it in my boat and use it quite often
I have the 140 and so does my boy they work very well. You will be happy with it. Being that it mounts on the boat everything is off to the side and boat. No wires to fool with.
